comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: May 11, 1914: the National Memorial Service for 17 U. S. sailors killed at Vera Cruz, Mexico, in April. Story in the New York Times, 5/11/14: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=940CE3DB173AE6...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: One of the tiny figures standing behind the bunting is U. S. President Woodrow Wilson. But which one is he?

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Wystan, Thanks for your efforts with the numerous photographs which document the National Memorial Service of May 11, 1914. We will be able to better link the related images and expand the descriptions, including the addition of a date where one is not yet included. I've marked with a note on the photograph where Pres. Wilson is standing at the central podium, head bowed. (If you go to the Prints and Photographs Online Catalog record for this photo and look at the largest digital file, you can see him.
